availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Emanuel Garcia (Mercer County, KY, tailor and soldier)

body.p:
Harrodsburg, Mercer County, Kentucky, tailor and soldier. Native of Mexico. Married Sarah Silch Garcia in Mercer County, Kentucky in March 1861. Father of Sarah Garcia.
Tailor in Harrodsburg in 1860. Alleged participant in Confederate raid in Harrodsburg, Kentucky in 1862. Allegedly served in Confederate forces under John Hunt Morgan. Mentioned in a December 3, 1863 letter from J.M. Quinton to Thomas E. Bramlette.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 704.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 604B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film #000191864, p. 237.
KYR-0001-004-0348.
